reg:regulation.reg:title: Buildings and Other Structures Bylaws Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 107/2007, April 27, 2007]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Code means the British Columbia Building Code Regulation, B.C. Reg. 216/2006.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Council's exercise of authority respecting buildings and other structures

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 9 (4) (a) of the Act, a council may adopt a bylaw that establishes standards for the construction, alteration, repair or demolition of buildings or structures

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: that are listed in sentence 1.1.1.1. (2) of Division A of the Code, or
that are not "buildings" as defined in the Code.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 9 (4) (a) and (b) of the Act, a council may adopt a bylaw that establishes standards for the construction, alteration, repair or demolition of a building or structure not referred to in subsection (1), subject to the restrictions that the bylaw must not

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: establish standards that are additional to or different from the standards established by the Code,
extend or change the application or scope of the Code as specified in articles 1.3.2.1, 1.3.3.1., 1.3.3.2. or 1.3.3.3. of Division A or subsection 2.2.7. of Division C of the Code, or
change the form of a letter that is set out in a schedule to subsection 2.2.7. of Division C of the Code.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions of the Community Charter, S.B.C. 2003, c. 26, relevant to the enactment of this regulation: section 9]
